title: Calories in a Sausage Patty
meta_description: Discover calories in a sausage patty, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and quick tweaks for variations like turkey or added cheese.
assumptions: Pork breakfast sausage patty, cooked (pan-fried), standard size (~28 g), no added seasonings or oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, meat type, size, cooking method, and additives. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard pork sausage patty provides ~100 kcal and ~5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use turkey sausage patty instead of pork
Add 1 slice of cheddar cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in a sausage patty?
faqs.a: About 100 kcal for a standard cooked pork sausage patty.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a sausage patty?
faqs.a: Approximately 9 g total fat, including 3 g saturated fat per patty.

faqs.q: Are sausage patties high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 300 mg sodium per patty due to seasoning.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in a sausage patty?
faqs.a: Pan-frying adds minimal calories if no extra oil; baking or air-frying keeps it similar.

faqs.q: What's a lower-calorie alternative to a pork sausage patty?
faqs.a: Try turkey or chicken sausage, which can reduce calories to ~70 kcal per patty.
